question: Ic (habban) #### ðe to secgenne sum þing⁠ — I have something to say
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the first person singular present form 'hæbbe' because the subject is 'I'

commonMistakes.explanation: When conjugated in the singular or past, the 'a' in 'habban' becomes an 'æ'

question: Ðu (libban) #### be godra manna ælmessan⁠ — You live by alms of good men
explanation: Here 'libban' is in the second person singular present form 'leofast' because the subject is 'You

question: Swa (secgan) #### ðæs huses hlaford⁠ — The lord of this house says so
explanation: Here 'secgan' is in the third person singular present form 'sægð' because the subject is 'the lord'

question: (hycgan) #### his ealle hu ge hie beswicen⁠ — All think of this, how you may deceive them
explanation: Here 'hycgan' is in the plural form 'hycgað' because the subject is 'all'

question: Ðis leoht we (habban) #### wið nytenu gemæne⁠ — This light we have in common with beasts
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the plural present form 'habbað' because the subject is 'We'

question: Hie be urum larum (libban) ####⁠ — They live according to our instructions
explanation: Here 'libban' is in the plural present form 'libbað' because the subject is 'They'

question: Ic ðe orlæg (secgan) ####⁠ — I told you your fate
explanation: Here 'secgan' is in the first person singular past form 'secgde' because the subject is 'I

question: Ðu (hycgan) #### on ellen ac wærwyrde sceal wisfæst hæle breostum hycgan⁠ — You thought on valour, but a wise and cautious man holds his thoughts to his breast
explanation: Here 'hycgan' is in the second person singular past form 'hogdest' because the subject is 'You'

question: On þissum geare (habban) #### se cyning his hired æt Gleaweceastre⁠ — On this year, the king had his court at Gloucester
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the third person singular past form 'hæfde' because the subject is 'the king'

commonMistakes.explanation: Close, but remember, 'habban' takes an 'æ' instead of an 'a' in all past tense conjugations

question: We ealne ðisne gear (libban) #### mid ures lichoman willan⁠ — we have lived all this year as it was pleasing to our body
explanation: Here 'libban' is in the plural form 'lifdon' because the subject is 'We'

question: Ge self synne (secgan) ####⁠ — You yourselves spoke sin
explanation: Here 'secgan' is in the plural past form 'sægdon' because the subject is the plural 'You'

question: Hie (hycgan) #### inwit ond facen on heortan geþoncum⁠ — They thought deceit and treachery with the thoughts of their heart
explanation: Here 'hycgan' is in the plural past form 'hogdon' because the subject is 'They'

question: Ic be me (secgan) #### ðis sarspell⁠ — I tell this lament about myself
explanation: Here 'secgan' is in the first person singular present form 'secge' because the subject is 'I'

question: Æðelwulf his dohtor (habban) #### him to cwene⁠ — Ethelwulf had his daughter for his queen
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the third person singular past form 'hæfde' because the subject is 'Ethelwulf'

question: Hie (habban) #### hine mid him oþ ðæt hie ofslogon hine⁠ — They had him with them until they slew him
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the plural past form 'hæfdon' because the subject is 'They'

question: For ðæm ic libbe ond ge (libban) ####⁠ — Because I live, you live
explanation: Here 'libban' is in the plural present form 'libbað' because the subject is the plural 'You'

question: Wynnum ond þeawum ic (libban) ####⁠ — I lived joyously and virutously
explanation: Here 'libban' is in the first person past singular form 'lifde' because the subject is 'I'

question: Heo (hycgan) #### georne ðæt hire mægþhad clæne geheolde⁠ — She earnestly intended to keep her maidenhood pure
explanation: Here 'hycgan' is in the third person singular past form 'hogde' because the subject is 'She'

question: Ge (habban) #### us gedon laðe Pharaone⁠ — You have made us hateful to Pharoh
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the plural present form 'habbað' because the subject is the plural 'You

question: Ðu me forlæred (habban) ####⁠ — You have seduced me
explanation: Here 'habban' is in the second person singular present form 'hæfst' because the subject is 'You'

commonMistakes.explanation: Remember, the 'b' in 'habban' becomes an 'f' in the 2nd and 3rd singular present, and all past tense conjugations
